byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Catherine Saint Louis from New York.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and CATHERINE SAINT LOUIS

abstract: Supporters of impending medical marijuana program in New York State worry that measure is so strict that it will prevent many deserving patients from receiving the drug; Health Dept restrictions include only 10 qualifying conditions, would prevent smoking of the drug, and would limit consumption to only 5 medical brands.
lead_paragraph: With the state close to issuing final regulations, supporters of the new program are concerned that some of its constraints will harm its effectiveness.

headline.main: New York State’s Medical Marijuana Rules Shaping Up as Unusually Restrictive
headline.print_headline: Medical Marijuana Regulations Are Shaping Up as Unusually Restrictive

snippet: With the state close to issuing final regulations, supporters of the new program are concerned that some of its constraints will harm its effectiveness.
